title.narrative: Enhance access to protection and lifesaving mechanisms to respond and prevent GBV, particularly trafficking and sexual exploitation of women who are part of the Venezuelan migratory influx.

description.narrative: The main objective of this UN Women project is to provide Venezuelan migrants with GBV centered services. UN Women will strengthen the capacity of 1000 first responders to detect, prevent and respond to cases of trafficking and sexual exploitation. Two safe spaces will be established in Rumichaca and San Miguel for women to access basic services for sexual and reproductive health. Secondly, UN Women will provide 250 women with a cash grant, to cover their basic needs to reduce the prevalence of trafficking and sexual exploitation. Some 1,280 individuals will be assisted over 5 months.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

name.narrative: Rumichaca (Carchi Province) and San Miguel (Sucumbíos Province), Ecuador

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Enhance access to protection and lifesaving mechanisms to respond and prevent GBV, particularly trafficking and sexual exploitation of women who are part of the Venezuelan migratory influx.

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS ECUADOR RAPID RESPONSE DISPLACEMENT 2018

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: 250 young adult women (especially those between 18-24 years old) victims of trafficking in persons receive cash assistance for complementing 1-month basic subsistence
Number of young adult women victims of trafficking in persons who receive cash assistance as part of attention packages
First responders (military and police officers) and community-based leaders receive training, lifesaving information and are sensitized on gender-based violence and trafficking
